intro: Alegria divaricata, commonly known as the variable joy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
